title: Gilberto Keb Baas
text:
Gilberto José Keb Baas (born October 21, 1977 in <a href="Hunucm%C3%A1%20Municipality">Hunucmá</a>, <a href="Yucat%C3%A1n%20%28state%29">Yucatán</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>) is a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> professional <a href="boxing">boxer</a> in the <a href="Light%20Flyweight">Light Flyweight</a> division. Gilberto is the former <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">WBC</a> <a href="Light%20Flyweight">Light Flyweight</a> Champion.
Pro career.
WBC Light Flyweight Championship.
He fought <a href="Omar%20Ni%C3%B1o%20Romero">Omar Niño Romero</a> on November 6, 2010, for the WBC light flyweight title at the Poliforum Zamna in <a href="M%C3%A9rida%2C%20Yucat%C3%A1n">Mérida</a>, <a href="Yucat%C3%A1n%20%28state%29">Yucatán</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. The bout ended with a controversial majority decision in favor of underdog Keb Baas.
In April 2011, he lost his world title to <a href="Adri%C3%A1n%20Hern%C3%A1ndez%20%28boxer%29">Adrián Hernández</a>.
